block.p: Alexandra Holberton, the daughter of Gale Russell Nash of McLean, Va., and Philip V. Holberton of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to William Needles Wight Jr., a son of Deborah Wight and William N. Wight of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. E. Bevan Stanley performed the Episcopal ceremony at Christ Church in Short Hills.
The couple graduated from Trinity College in Hartford, where they met.

Alexandra Holberton, the daughter of Gale Russell Nash of McLean, Va., and Philip V. Holberton of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to William Needles Wight Jr., a son of Deborah Wight and William N. Wight of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. E. Bevan Stanley performed the Episcopal ceremony at Christ Church in Short Hills.
The couple graduated from Trinity College in Hartford, where they met.

Mrs. Wight, 26, is a candidate for a doctorate in psychology at the City University of New York Graduate Center and a home-care case manager at the Alpine Learning Group, a school for autistic children and young adults in Paramus, N.J. Her father is a business finance and executive-training consultant in Lincoln. Her mother is a saleswoman at the Brooks Brothers store in Washington. The bride is the stepdaughter of Anne Blodget Holberton and of Joseph E. Nash.

Mr. Wight, 30, is a corporate bond trader in Stamford, Conn., with UBS Warburg, the investment bank. His father, who is retired, was a managing director for bonds at Salomon Brothers, the investment bank in New York.
